ygData.subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Attack, AC, resists
ygData.msgSnippet: There is rumored to be an 1100 soft cap on AC .  Soft cap meaning you can have an AC above this point but you will show decreasing marginal returns for the
ygData.messageBody:
There is rumored to be an 1100 "soft cap" on AC . 

" Soft" cap meaning you can have an AC above this point but you will show decreasing marginal returns for the additional AC (like 200+ Int for casters).  There is no Hard Cap (i.e. an upper limit of what the game will dsplay) as far as I know.

However, noone has proved this soft cap really exists via logs (i.e. no one has done a study using a log parser above and below 1100 AC to show the effectiveness of additional AC above & below this point).

If you are interested in more info go to the eq.stratics warrior class board...there is a long thread on it.

Flair Shieldrender
54 Champion Fennin Ro

Nygaardr, FC3 wrote:
My gnome warrior has 169 Unbuffed Str.  And at lvl 53 has over 1000 attack.
Although the AC is still hovers around 900 Unbuffed (forget the exact
numbers)

Mu

-----Original Message-----
From: Paul Jesernig [mailto:pwjesernig@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 20, 2001 12:02 AM
To: warriors_eq@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [warriors_eq] Attack, AC, resists


Attack and AC do not cap at 1000. I've seen 1100+ AC on a level 55 warrior
and over 1000 attack on a warrior at 51. The 1000+ attack needed 255+ STR
and wolfform at 51, don't think an inkie will ever get STR that high though.
Not sure what your resists question is about. Aim to get them all around 60
un buff!
ed so a resist buff will take you to 100. Once you get resists above
90 most non epic in nature mobs (gods, dragons and such are epic) won't be
able to get a spell to stick on you.

Oglug ~Hand of Chaos~, CT

   Date: Sun, 18 Feb 2001 18:52:04 -0800 (PST)
   From: Sinarya L'achesis <selene1212@...>
Subject: AC / Attack Question for High Levels

Just wondering if anyone could tell me if our
Armor class and attack caps at 1000, seeing as on
the character inventory screen they are listed as
xxx/1000 - Does anyone have this info? Also, are
there any caps on our resists level? Any
information provided will be appreciated... =)
Thanks.

As Always,

Kinrea Keres
